author: Anonymous Scale
title: reference rules
question:
edx video said that it can only use one function on refered to type, otherwise, need a natural helper function
on lecture, the professor said only can call for one selector, otherwise, need a natural helper
for example
if we just need to (+ (selector 1) (selector 2)) for the refered type
this is indeed one function operator "+" , however, this consumes tow selectors 
whether this one need natural helper function or not?
instructor_answer:
First let's change your expression to:
(+ (selector-1 x) (selector-2 x))
Which is probably what you intended to write.
Note that + is not being called with x as an argument.  So it is not called on x.  Only the selectors are called on x.  So this code calls two selectors on x.
